title: Can't import from Thinderbird (Linux) dektop to Thunderbird Mobile on Android
creator: peng.thinkblue+mfx
content: I just learned about Thunderbird Mobile for Android and installed it from F-droid. Everything seemed to go okay until I tried to import my settings from the desktop (Thunderbird 128.7.0esr (64-bit) running on SolydK Linux 12 (Debian Bookworm)). I lined up the QR code (I think) and pressed the Done button, but it just dumped me back to the Getting Started screen without accessing my settings at all.

title: New email sign up
creator: a.m.albertson12
content: I am looking to switch from gmail to mozilla thunderbird. I am currently using a chromebook, and can only access the android version. How do I create a mozilla thunderbird email so I can delete my google account?

title: all outgoing emails being rejected by ISP
creator: misc30
content: Switched to Android Thunderbird at end of January. Used export function from PC for most of my email accounts but had to do some manually. All emails from Thunderbird Android are being returned - blocked, that is the exported and manual configurations. I have cross checked PC configuration with Android Configuration - same. Thunderbird version 8.2 Android version 12 Help please.

title: Old Mail search on server
creator: info12562
content:
Hello, TB only searches for Android in the loaded mails. If nothing is found there, how can I extend the search to the server? I don't want to load all the mails.

Hallo, bei mir sucht TB Android nur in den geladenen Mails. Wenn dort nichts gefunden wird, wie kann ich dann die Suche auf den Server erweitern? Ich m√∂chte aber nicht alle Mails laden.

title: Shortcut keys
creator: annieatanchor
content:
Kia ora. I have just downloaded Thunderbird for Android - I always used it in the past, when I had a 'proper' laptop, so was really pleased to see that it was now available. I use a Bluetooth keyboard with my tablet, which transforms using the tablet into something like a laptop. However, my shortcut keys don't seem to work with Thunderbird, like they used to. I can't create bold or italics (there's nothing like the little icons at the top of this box, for example), or move up and down the screen with keystrokes. I can find nothing in the help about this topic. Please can someone help me, or is the Thunderbird for Android of very limited utility?

Thank you in advance.

Annie
